message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question states that the new medication interacts with the same target as the previous medication but at a different binding site. Therefore, potential side-effects are likely to be similar. Among the options, only weight gain is a known side-effect of some diabetes medications, such as insulin and sulfonylureas. Hepatotoxicity and lactic acidosis are more commonly associated with Metformin. Urinary tract infections are not typically associated with diabetes medications.
